titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 129
CWG12540

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: Union Artillery, Navy and Marines Primary Source Documents ; Misc U.S.C.T. Primary Source Documents

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFICE,
Washington, March 28th, 1864.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 129.
(Extract.)
52. Captain James Thompson, 2d U. S. Artillery, is hereby relieved from his present duties, and will report in person, without delay, to Major W. H. Sidell, Superintendent of Volunteer Recruiting Service, at Louisville, Ky., for temporary Mustering and Disbursing duty.
By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.

War Department
Adjutant Generals Office
Washington March 28. 1864.
Townsend. E. D.
A. A G.
Order releiving Capt. Thompson 2nd U. S. Artillery from his present duties to report to Maj W. H. Sidell U. S. A. Louisville Ky for temporary Mustering & Disbursing Duty.
Recd A. G. O. April 4 1864
